## wordwrap() function

Word-wrap a string to the specified width.

Wraps text at word boundaries (spaces, hyphens), keeping words intact. This is the recommended function for most use cases.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function wordwrap(s: string, limit: number, options?: WordWrapOptions): string;
```

**Returns:**

string

The wrapped string

## Example


```ts
const wrapped = wordwrap("Hello World, this is a test!", 10);
// "Hello\nWorld,\nthis is a\ntest!"
```
